other_tests.findings: In the visualized thorax, there is mild dependent bibasilar atelectasis. The heart is normal in size without pericardial effusion. The liver, gallbladder, pancreas, spleen, and adrenals appear normal. Kidneys symmetrically take up and excrete contrast without hydronephrosis. Tiny subcentimeter hypodensities are seen bilaterally, too small to characterize. Abdominal loops of bowel appear normal. There is no pericolonic fat stranding or bowel wall thickening, free air or free fluid. There is no pathologic lymphadenopathy in the abdomen. A blind-ended tubular structure demonstrates mucosal enhancement, fat effacement, and measures to 1.5 cm in diameter. There is no phlegmon or free air in this area. Scattered nodes are seen proximal to this site of inflammation. The bladder, distal ureters, prostate, and seminal vesicles appear normal. There is no suspicious osteolytic or osteoblastic lesion. Pars defects seen at L5-S1.
